news.title: MetaMask Security Monthly: March 2024
news.subtitle: Lots of exciting activity from ETHDenver and some new snaps additions are covered in this month‚Äôs installment. Plus, the recording of this quarter‚Äôs State of Security X Space is now available.

ü¶ä What We‚Äôve Been Up To ü¶ä

Snaps Stories


If you haven‚Äôt already, we invite you to try out the [Account Management Snaps](https://support.metamask.io/hc/en-us/articles/20069338322075-What-are-Account-Management-Snaps) open beta, featuring snaps created by Capsule, Safeheron, and Silent Shard.

While the Snaps open beta that began several months ago included a variety of security snaps, we have a newly added transaction simulation snap from DeFi Armor. Warnings are issued when a transaction fails DeFi Armor's curated and customizable security policy, along with a detailed explanation of what went wrong.

Happy Harpie‚Äôs ETHDenver hackathon project is a signature insight snap that decodes signatures and runs all addresses detected in signature payloads through Harpie to warn the user about malicious addresses. It also decodes Seaport NFT listing signatures and warns the user if the listing price is significantly below floor price. Signature insights will be available in MetaMask Flask (experimental developer playground) soon and in the stable extension in early Q2.

üéôÔ∏è MetaMask in the Security Ecosystem üîé

MetaMask Security Spotlight at ETHDenver


MetaMask held a security spotlight event this month in Denver, joined by some of our friends from Alterya, Blockaid, Chain Patrol, Forta, Hexagate, Hypernative, Karma3 Labs, Paradigm, and Wallet Guard. A huge thank you to everyone who participated. Video recordings are now available to everyone!

MetaMask + WalletGuard State of Security X Event


This quarter‚Äôs X (FKA Twitter) event was co-hosted by Ian Wallis, Ohm Shah, and Michael K. Topics included:

  • Future-Proofing
  • Current & Future AI Threats
  • Latest Social Engineering & Phishing Techniques
  • Airdrops, Farming & Associated Risks
  • Special edition coverage of ETHDenver security discussions

If you missed it, you can catch the recording here.

Blockfence's Blockchain Security Series ft. Taylor Monahan


Taylor joins Blockfence's Head of Security Research, Pablo Sabbetlla, to discuss the importance of builders to protect their users, love for white hat hackers, and details about a chain of attacks on older wallets that occurred last April. Hint: don't store your secret recovery phrase in a password manager. Additionally, Taylor and Pablo encourage you to do one small thing every day to make yourself more secure.
 

‚ö†Ô∏è Tales of Caution ‚ö†Ô∏è

Inferno Drainer Compromised for $2.5M


Summary

On March 18, Inferno Drainer was compromised for $2.5M, diverting funds to 0x61640ff8B9D3C3726F1bF02319671061d9d61E1F. Security researcher ZachXBT shared a leaked message from an Inferno Drainer Customer group chat. It notified customers that the attacker had updated all customer addresses to the attacker's address. This means customers who performed a successful phishing attack on March 18 had the stolen funds redirected to the attacker's address instead of their customer's address.

How Users Can Protect Themselves

Although this was related to an off-chain compromise, the original $2.5M came from victims of phishing attacks. Users must exercise caution when clicking on links shared on social media platforms, as even accounts perceived as trustworthy have fallen victim to hacks, resulting in significant losses of funds. It is also highly recommended to keep substantial funds in hardware wallets, while wallets used for daily transactions should contain only minimal assets. Taking these steps can help safeguard against the loss of the majority, if not all, of your cryptocurrency holdings. Using different accounts for different transactions based on the level of risk can also mitigate against potential damages.

FTX and BlockFi users targeted in Email Phishing Campaign


Summary

FTX and BlockFi users lost more than US$ 7 million on the Ethereum mainnet the week of March 18 as they were targeted in a phishing campaign. The specific threat actor, 0x6C0e83422cD73fFD3A5EC4506638F6A0A8e22b38, used popular daas (drainer as a service) Pink Drainer to conduct the on-chain portion of the scheme. Many users signed a malicious signature or interacted with a malicious contract, resulting in their wallets being drained of crypto assets. It‚Äôs reported that the email list used in this campaign likely came from the Mailerlite compromise.

How Users Can Protect Themselves

Users must exercise caution when receiving emails asking them to connect their wallets and sign transactions. To prevent being scammed by impersonators, it is recommended that users check official communications from the organization. A simple search on BlockFi‚Äôs and FTX‚Äôs websites would have revealed that no official announcement allowed users to withdraw funds. Taking these steps can help safeguard against the loss of the majority, if not all, of your cryptocurrency holdings.

Curio‚Äôs MakerDao-Based Contract Exploited for $16M


Summary

On the weekend of March 23rd Curio Ecosystem broke the news that their MakerDao-based smart contracts on Ethereum were exploited. This resulted in a total loss of over $16M in crypto assets. All contracts on Polkadot and the Curio Chain itself remained secure. Curio recently posted its recovery strategy roadmap, highlighting that 100% of funds will be restored to users.

How Users Can Protect Themselves

Everyone who was a holder of Curio‚Äôs governance token was impacted. Unfortunately, this is a scenario where a user would not have been able to protect themselves from this attack, as it involved a vulnerability within Curios‚Äô smart contracts. For those of you who are protocol developers, you can help prevent these attacks by ensuring your smart contracts are thoroughly audited. It's a best practice to have your smart contracts audited continuously with new releases. After completing an audit, projects should participate in a bug bounty program to incentivize researchers to find vulnerabilities in their contracts before threat actors do.

image.title: How to buy crypto
image.description: Explore the ways MetaMask makes buying crypto speedy, simple, and secure.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Wondering how to buy crypto, but not sure where to start? You‚Äôve come to the right place. Buying crypto with MetaMask is swift, seamless, and safe. You can use methods like a credit card, debit card, bank account, Apple Pay, Google Pay, or PayPal. No need for centralized exchanges. We‚Äôve cut out all of the unnecessary steps ‚Äî saving you time, and money on excess fees too.

Below, we'll give you an overview of how we make MetaMask wallet powerful, secure, and configurable when you buy cryptocurrencies. Then, you'll find videos and step-by-step guides showing you exactly how to buy crypto with MetaMask on your browser or mobile app.

Let's get into it! ü¶ä

How MetaMask empowers you

  • Buy crypto straight into your MetaMask wallet.
  • Choose the best quote from our industry-leading aggregator.
  • Avoid centralized exchanges, extra steps, and additional costs.
  • Use MetaMask wallet in 188 countries with over 80 currencies available.
  • Select from hundreds of your favorite tokens across 15+ networks including: Ethereum, Linea, Optimism, BNB Chain, Polygon, zkSync, Base, Arbitrum, and Avalanche.
  • Go from cash to crypto back to cash. All in one place.

How MetaMask keeps you secure

  • Get 24/7 help whenever you need it from our expert customer service team.
  • We only work with trusted providers, ensuring that they comply with applicable regulations and are legitimate, responsible parties.
  • Preserving your privacy is paramount: MetaMask does not store ‚Äî nor do we have access to ‚Äî any personal information you provide when buying or selling crypto, such as payment details, personal data, or email addresses.
  • Unlike a centralized exchange, neither MetaMask nor our partners have access to the cryptocurrencies after you purchase or transfer them, meaning you can access your assets immediately without a holding period.

How MetaMask gives you choice

  • Choose your preferred way to buy crypto: debit card, credit card, bank transfer, instant ACH, PayPal, Apple Pay, Google Pay, Ideal, SEPA bank transfers, and alternative local payment methods. These are subject to availability based on your region.
  • Select your preferred quote and provider.
  • Using MetaMask Extension on desktop or the MetaMask app on mobile.

Buy crypto with MetaMask Extension

Clicking the Buy & Sell button on the MetaMask extension will redirect you to MetaMask Portfolio. Once there, connect your MetaMask wallet.

  1. Click Move crypto.
  2. Click Buy.
  3. Select your region, and currency ‚Äî located to the right of your wallet address.
  4. Select the payment method you want to use to buy crypto. Example: debit card, credit card, bank account, or PayPal balance. Availability will depend on your region.
  5. Select the crypto token and network that you want to buy on. Example: ETH on Ethereum.
  6. Enter the amount you want to buy. Example: 0.5 ETH Example: $100 of ETH.
  7. Select the best real-time quote from our industry-leading providers.
  8. You'll be securely redirected to the provider's website to complete the purchase, and funds will be deposited into your MetaMask wallet.

Success! ü¶ä

Buy crypto with MetaMask mobile app

  1. Sign-in to your MetaMask app.
  2. Tap the menu button, which has two arrows in opposite directions and is located on the bottom of your homepage screen.
  3. Tap Buy
  4. Select your region and currency ‚Äî located to the right of your wallet address.
  5. Select the crypto token and network that you want to buy on. Example: ETH on Ethereum.
  6. Enter the amount you want to buy. Example: 0.5 ETH.
  7. Select the payment method you want to use to buy crypto. Example: debit card, credit card, bank account, or PayPal balance. Availability will depend on your region.
  8. Tap Get quotes to proceed. Select the best quote from our industry-leading providers.
  9. Complete the transaction on the provider‚Äôs portal, and link your desired payment method.
  10. Review the order summary in your MetaMask app, and confirm the transaction to get crypto in your wallet.

Success! ü¶ä

Ready to get started? If you‚Äôre on desktop, download MetaMask Extension. If you‚Äôre on mobile, download MetaMask app for iOS or Android.

Need more help? We got you. Head to MetaMask Support to speak with our team of experts around-the-clock.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Selling crypto for cash is as simple as can be with MetaMask. You can exchange crypto from MetaMask wallet directly to your debit card, credit card, PayPal, or bank account. No unnecessary steps, no excess fees, no worries.

Below, we'll give you an overview of how we make MetaMask wallet powerful, secure, and configurable when you sell cryptocurrencies. Then, you'll find videos and step-by-step guides showing you how to sell crypto with MetaMask on your browser or mobile app.

Let's get into it! ü¶ä

How MetaMask empowers you

  • Sell directly from your MetaMask wallet, and send cash to the place that works for you.
  • Choose the best quote from our industry-leading aggregator.
  • Avoid centralized exchanges, extra steps, and additional costs.
  • Use MetaMask wallet in 188 countries with over 80 currencies available.
  • Buy crypto, use crypto, and sell crypto. All in one place.

How MetaMask keeps you secure

  • Get 24/7 help whenever you need it from our expert customer service team.
  • We only work with trusted providers, ensuring that they comply with applicable regulations and are legitimate, responsible parties.
  • Preserving your privacy is paramount: MetaMask does not store ‚Äî nor do we have access to ‚Äî any personal information you provide when buying or selling crypto, such as payment details, personal data, or email addresses.
  • Unlike a centralized exchange, neither MetaMask nor our partners have access to the cryptocurrencies after you purchase or transfer them, meaning you can access your assets immediately without a holding period.

How MetaMask gives you choice

  • Choose your preferred destination for your cash including: debit card, credit card, bank transfer, and PayPal.
  • Select your preferred quote and provider.
  • Sell crypto using MetaMask Extension on desktop or the MetaMask app on mobile.

Sell crypto with MetaMask Extension

Click the Buy & Sell button on MetaMask extension to redirect to MetaMask Portfolio. Once there, connect your MetaMask wallet.

  1. Click Move crypto.
  2. Click Sell.
  3. Select your region, and currency ‚Äî located to the right of your wallet address.
  4. Enter the amount of crypto that you want to sell. Example: 0.5 ETH.
  5. Select the account destination you want. Example: debit card, credit card, bank account, or PayPal balance. Availability will depend on your region.
  6. Select the best real-time quote from our industry-leading providers. You'll be securely redirected to the provider‚Äôs website where you may have to share KYC, then directed back to MetaMask Portfolio once you accept the quote.
  7. After returning to MetaMask Portfolio, click Send ETH.
  8. Click Confirm to complete the transaction in your MetaMask wallet.

Note: You can click on Sell to keep track of your order as it is processed. Times may vary depending on provider.

Success! ü¶ä

Sell crypto with MetaMask app

  1. Sign-in to your MetaMask app.
  2. Tap on the menu button‚Äö which has two arrows in opposite directions and is located on the bottom of your homepage screen.
  3. Tap Sell.
  4. Select your region and currency ‚Äî located to the right of your wallet address.
  5. Enter the crypto amount you want to sell. Example: 0.5 ETH.
  6. Tap Send your cash to and select the account destination you want. Example: debit card, credit card, bank account, or PayPal. Availability will depend on your region.
  7. Tap Get quotes to proceed.
  8. Select the best quote from our industry-leading providers. You'll be securely redirected to the provider‚Äôs portal, where you may have to share KYC, then directed back to MetaMask app once you accept the quote.
  9. Review the order summary in your MetaMask app, and tap Confirm to complete the transaction.

Note: You can tap on progress notification to keep track of your order as it is processed. Times may vary depending on provider.

Success! ü¶ä

Ready to get started? If you‚Äôre on desktop, download MetaMask Extension. If you‚Äôre on mobile, download MetaMask app in the Apple Store or Google Store.

Need more help? We got you. Head to MetaMask Support to speak with our team of experts around-the-clock.

nodes.title: Transfers from Coinbase and Binance now available in MetaMask
nodes.subtitle: MetaMask launches new CEX transfer feature to make your wallet more powerful.

image.title: Centralized exchange transfers MetaMask now available
image.description: Centralized exchange transfers from Coinbase and Binance now available on MetaMask.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
MetaMask Portfolio now supports centralized exchange (CEX) transfers from Coinbase and Binance, streamlining the process of transferring assets to your crypto wallet.

Many web3 users have digital assets divided across multiple wallets and accounts, creating a fragmented experience. Moving assets from one platform to another can be overly complicated and involve many steps‚Äîfraught with the risks of copying and pasting addresses incorrectly, and potential security concerns. MetaMask‚Äôs new CEX transfer feature is a solution to this issue, making your wallet more powerful, while also strengthening security.

Instant transfer of assets from centralized exchanges into your MetaMask wallet

MetaMask CEX transfers allow you to immediately move assets between accounts, eliminating the need for manually entering addresses. And, if you have bank accounts linked to your Coinbase or Binance accounts, purchasing crypto directly with your bank account to your MetaMask wallet has never been easier. No additional KYC necessary.

In April 2024, MetaMask partnered with Meld and Mesh to launch a feature that allowed users to track external CEX balances by linking Coinbase or Binance accounts directly from the MetaMask Portfolio dashboard. Now, you can view CEX balances, and also transfer assets from these exchanges into your MetaMask wallet. Neither MetaMask, nor our partners in this integration, will ever have access to your exchange login credentials, or share your wallet addresses with third parties.

CEX transfers will initially support Coinbase or Binance accounts, with expansion to additional exchanges on the horizon. No fees will be charged when transferring digital assets from exchanges to MetaMask. A nominal transaction fee of 0.25% will be applied when transferring from MetaMask to centralized exchanges. Network gas fees also apply.

By bridging the gap between self-custodial and centralized platforms, MetaMask is paving the way for a more powerful, integrated, and user-friendly DeFi ecosystem. Head to MetaMask Portfolio today to get started with CEX transfers.
